Taxon.name: Measure.Length

mtc:Parameter.name: StartPointX
mtc:Parameter.mtc:Definition: Start Point on the X-Axis distance from the reference

mtc:Parameter.name: StartPointY
mtc:Parameter.mtc:Definition: Start Point on the Y-Axis distance from the reference

mtc:Parameter.name: StartPointZ
mtc:Parameter.mtc:Definition: Start Point on the Z-Axis distance from the reference

mtc:Parameter.name: EndPointX
mtc:Parameter.mtc:Definition: Start Point on the X-Axis distance from the reference

mtc:Parameter.name: EndPointY
mtc:Parameter.mtc:Definition: Start Point on the Y-Axis distance from the reference

mtc:Parameter.name: EndPointZ
mtc:Parameter.mtc:Definition: Start Point on the Z-Axis distance from the reference

Taxon.mtc:Definition: Length is the straight-line distance between two points. It can be measured in one, two, or three dimensions with 6 degrees of freedom. Length measurements are made from Point 1 to Point 2 based on the reference definition of an ISO or ASME standard datum specifically defining the orientation and references for each of the x,y,z points. The start and end points allow defining and distinguishing direction if required; otherwise, they are interchangeable.
